title: Shatrughan Sinha takes pot shots at Centre over rising prices of pulses
text:
NEW DELHI: BJP MP Shatrughan Sinha, who has lately been making veiled attacks on the party leadership, expressed concern on Friday at the spiralling price of pulses and asked the Centre to take urgent steps to contain it.
The spike in Dal prices has come soon after onion prices had brought tears to the people in recent past, the actor-politician said, a remark which may not go down well with the BJP leadership in the midst of the Bihar elections.
"Dal prices touch Rs 200. Urgent steps required by Centre to contain this! We have seen the tears that onion prices have brought in the past," Sinha, a former Union minister in the Atal Bihari Vajpayee government, said in a series of tweets.
Referring to the Bihar assembly polls, the BJP leader left everybody guessing on who he favoured to win the electoral battle. "I pray that the election results are also in favour of those who will propel our Bihar on the road of true progress," the 69-year-old leader said.
"This is a festival that celebrates the victory of Good over Evil, Right over Wrong, Truth over Falsehood and Humility over Arrogance," he said.
"Happy to be back ... after a break. Best wishes to all, specially fellow Biharis, in this auspicious festive season from their own Bihari Babu," the veteran actor said in another tweet.
Sinha has been blowing hot and cold with the BJP leadership since he was elected to the Lok Sabha for a second term last year.
He had even met Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar and RJD chief Lalu Prasad on a couple of occasions in the recent past, leaving tongues wagging.
The party leadership however, decided to ignore the barbs from Sinha to ensure that a confrontation with him did not escalate in the election season.
BJP has so far not drafted him for campaign in Bihar despite naming him in the list of 40 star campaigners which was sent to the Election Commission before commencement of the poll process.
